results.title: Trevor Island
results.brief_description:
The latest adventure from Australia’s ATOM award winning supercat. Trevor’s family move to a tropical island and decide to set up an airport and car park. A sedate lifestyle, however, is not Trevor’s trademark. As usual, Trevor meets this challenge in his own way.
Voices by Richard Healy, Jane Lewis, Danny Nash, David Crosbie and John Taylor.

results.title: Tregatay Tracadie: river through time
results.creator_credit: David McLeod, Dennis Sawyer and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A two-year archaeological dig at several sites along the shores of the Tracadie River in New Brunswick unearths artifacts that support an old man’s memories of the days when Indians would camp every summer by the river and weave baskets and that point to the presence of Micmac indians over thousands of years. Archaeologists Micmac explain the nature and function of the ceramic pieces and stone implements. This film jolts its audience into the realization that history is all around us, and not something that exists only in distant lands. Voice and Narration: David Keenlyside, Judy Keenlyside
results.creator_credit_for_label: David McLeod, Dennis Sawyer and ONF | NFB

results.title: Trees for the wheatlands
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The importance of trees for shade and shelter, beautification, and control of wind erosion in certain areas of the wheatbelt. The Forests Department of Western Australia renders valuable service to farmers and others who desire to plant trees on their properties.

results.title: Trees (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Produced for the Australian National Botanic Gardens, this video explains the functions and uses of trees. It starts with the main parts of a tree, (the roots, leaves and trunk): the processes of photosynthesis, respiration and transpiration and the important part trees play in the water and air cycles, as well as helping to prevent soil erosion. The video then goes on to identify the role trees play in providing food and shelter for the birds and animals, and timber, paper and food for man. The message is clear; Care for trees.

results.title: Tree power
results.creator_credit: James Littleton, Don Hopkins, Judy LeGros and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Over half a million Canadian homes are using wood for heating. With the price of oil escalating, more people are converting to this traditional source of energy. In interviews with home owners and experts, advice is given about building regulations, insurance policies, maintenance procedures, and installation of efficient wood-burning units. The greatest potential for wood is in its combination with oil, gas, or electric back-up heating systems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Littleton, Don Hopkins, Judy LeGros and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tree business
results.creator_credit: Don Saunders, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A forest survey team is shown working in New Guinea, using modern methods of selecting and evaluating areas for commercial operations. Timber and forest products were always important, and efficient exploitation makes logging a major industry, briefly shown in operation

results.title: Treble one
results.creator_credit: Peter Saunders, John Robins and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: A tribute to 111 Squadron, Royal Air Force, which until recently provided the RAF aerobatic team. Visiting the Squadron’s station in Suffolk, takes a brief look at the ground services - particularly radar equipment and safety procedures - then concentrates on flying sequences which end with some spectacular aerobatic scenes.

results.title: Treatment of speech and reading problems
results.brief_description: This film shows that by using the neurological profile derived from the testing procedure, an individual program can be planned. The various remedial exercises are fully demonstrated in the film. (Teacher education)

results.title: Treasures of the Trust
results.brief_description: This superb video takes you on a tour of the paintings, antiques, furniture and gardens of some of Britain’s greatest and most famous homes, castles, and ruins…you’ll learn the history of the locations visited and tour the homes and grounds of National Trust sites. Places visited range from the breathtaking monastic remains of the 12th Century Fountains Abbey in Yorkshire, to the dramatic splendour of St. Michael’s Mount in Cornwall, including Tatton Park in Cheshire, Powis in Wales, Corfe Castle in Dorset, Kingston Lacy in Surrey and Chartwell in Kent.
